To modify the preferences to configure the Firefox browser (or IE) to send its HTTP information to the HTTP recorder, we need to evaluate and modify the prefs.js file for Default user for FireFox.  

This NPE can only mean that we could not find the path to the default preferences file for Firefox.  Specifically, we could not find the default directory that holds the 'prefs.js' file.  We are looking in the following place :

User.Home\Application Data\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\xxxx.default\prefs.js

where User.Home is your Windows user home, for example: 
C:\Documents and Settings\myUser

and xxxx.default where xxx is a random number/letter combination.  For example, on my machine it is '2lc3rbag.default'.  

This leads to a complete path for the prefs.js file as: 
C:\Documents and Settings\mdunn\Application Data\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\2lc3rbag.default\prefs.js.

One problem I will fix is to prevent this NPE from occurring by checking the object before using it.  

Please enter a comment for the full path to the prefs.js file for Firefox, and I will go from there.

Fixed this bug and committed on 2/10/2006.  if we can't find the ".default" directory, we now also look for a "default." directory as reported by the user. 

Also, if can't find the preference file, we put an Error message up explaining the problem and stop the recording.

We can petition to have this included in the next 4.1 maintenance build when one in announced. We missed the last maintenance build (4.1.0.1).
